subject: Re: [junit] Re: Swingui TestRunner
msgSnippet: The little row of happy dots is just as good, at least for me. *********** REPLY SEPARATOR  *********** ... dynamic ... the ... tests, ... frequently) ... I
messageBody:
The little row of happy dots is just as good, at least for me.

*********** REPLY SEPARATOR ***********

On 2002-07-18 at 14:10 Mike Clark wrote:

>Vladimir Bossicard wrote:
>
>>My experience:
>>
>>- I started by using the Swing runner because I really liked the
dynamic
>>reloading of the classes.
>>- I then discovered Cygwin and Ant and since then I totally dropped
the
>Swing
>>runner (never used it once). The reason is simple: I run all the
tests,
>all
>>the time, I don't have reloading problem, I can work with xml without
>modifying
>>the excluded.properties file.
>>
>
>You're obviously not addicted to a green bar! :-)
>
>Seriously, I find hitting the "Run" button (which I do very
frequently)
>faster than firing up a new JVM for Ant. And when there is a failure,
I
>double-click it in the Swing UI to jump right to the offending line of
>code.
>
>But that's just me...
>
>Mike
>
>
